bioghist.head: Historical Information
bioghist.p: The general store owned by Benjamin Waddey conducted business in the town of Lancaster in Lancaster County, Virginia during the mid-nineteenth century.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Information
scopecontent.p: Daybook, 1834 September - 1836 July, of a general store owned by Benjamin Waddey that records in chronological order the daily transactions of an unidentified general store. Information recorded in the daybook includes name of customer, date of transaction, merchandise purchased, quantity purchased, price of each item, and amount owed. Merchandise sold includes spices, nails, dry-goods, clothing, cigars, saw files, pocket knives, cheese, paper, cologne, bacon, and tin cups.
